issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: the current "working" animation is fug. We get sizeable spinners with FontAwesome which should be included in our dependency epic. from font-awesome See http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/spinner/
fields.summary: update "working" animation to something that looks better

comments.body: PR 1296 merged, assigning to [~jloza] for UX review (on master branch).
you're using instead of
I had issues with fa-pulse not working, so thought I'd try fa-spin
It should work...it's preferable stylistically for sure so I'd rather make pulse work if we can, please.

pulse icon looks better, thanks! The icon seems to "bounce" on the login page, can you look into that? 

Also where else (besides landing pages) is it used so I can go look?
It's used on the user landing page (each row lazy loads) and on places where we do smart-refresh, which could be landing and detail pages.
the icon is huge on landing pages when loading the table/tabs, can you make it a little smaller (not too small)
I have a branch (GUI-1636) with FA updates and I've tweaked the size there. (2x instead of 3x does look better)
fixed in the GUI-1636 branch (not merged at this time)

Thanks, [~dkavanagh]! That icon makes me so much happier. :)

UX review passed, ready for code review

[~dkavanagh]: The fact that you fixed the working animation in GUI-1636, which has nothing to do with GUI-1573, is incredibly frustrating.  Also frustrating is the fact that you conflated the selenium nav test fixes (from GUI-1474) with GUI-1489.  Please do not combine unrelated tickets in a single PR, it makes reviewing these tickets far more complicated than it should be.

/cc [~jloza]

GUI-1636 had other FA updates and so was totally related to that FA change and it was far less overhead to simply change 1 character for the size of the busy indicator than open an entirely new PR for that one change. Just being practical.
